description: Retrieves a configured table analysis rule.

parameters.name: configuredTableIdentifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the configured table to retrieve. Currently accepts the configured table ID.

parameters.name: analysisRuleType
parameters.description: The analysis rule to be retrieved. Configured table analysis rules are uniquely identified by their configured table identifier and analysis rule type.

nested_items.name: analysisRule
nested_items.description: The entire analysis rule output.

nested_items.name: configuredTableId
nested_items.description: The unique ID for the configured table.

nested_items.name: configuredTableArn
nested_items.description: The unique ARN for the configured table.

nested_items.name: joinColumns
nested_items.description: Columns that can be used to join a configured table with the table of the member who can query and other members' configured tables.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: allowedJoinOperators
nested_items.description: The logical operators (if any) that are to be used in an INNER JOIN match condition. Default is AND.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: listColumns
nested_items.description: Columns that can be listed in the output.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: additionalAnalyses
nested_items.description: An indicator as to whether additional analyses (such as Clean Rooms ML) can be applied to the output of the direct query.

nested_items.name: aggregation
nested_items.description: Analysis rule type that enables only aggregation queries on a configured table.

nested_items.name: aggregateColumns
nested_items.description: The columns that query runners are allowed to use in aggregation queries.

nested_items.name: columnNames
nested_items.description: Column names in configured table of aggregate columns.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: function
nested_items.description: Aggregation function that can be applied to aggregate column in query.

nested_items.name: joinColumns
nested_items.description: Columns in configured table that can be used in join statements and/or as aggregate columns. They can never be outputted directly.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: joinRequired
nested_items.description: Control that requires member who runs query to do a join with their configured table and/or other configured table in query.

nested_items.name: allowedJoinOperators
nested_items.description: Which logical operators (if any) are to be used in an INNER JOIN match condition. Default is AND.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: dimensionColumns
nested_items.description: The columns that query runners are allowed to select, group by, or filter by.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: scalarFunctions
nested_items.description: Set of scalar functions that are allowed to be used on dimension columns and the output of aggregation of metrics.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: outputConstraints
nested_items.description: Columns that must meet a specific threshold value (after an aggregation function is applied to it) for each output row to be returned.

nested_items.name: columnName
nested_items.description: Column in aggregation constraint for which there must be a minimum number of distinct values in an output row for it to be in the query output.

nested_items.name: minimum
nested_items.description: The minimum number of distinct values that an output row must be an aggregation of. Minimum threshold of distinct values for a specified column that must exist in an output row for it to be in the query output.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of aggregation the constraint allows. The only valid value is currently COUNT_DISTINCT.

nested_items.name: additionalAnalyses
nested_items.description: An indicator as to whether additional analyses (such as Clean Rooms ML) can be applied to the output of the direct query.

nested_items.name: allowedAnalyses
nested_items.description: The ARN of the analysis templates that are allowed by the custom analysis rule.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: allowedAnalysisProviders
nested_items.description: The IDs of the Amazon Web Services accounts that are allowed to query by the custom analysis rule. Required when allowedAnalyses is ANY_QUERY.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: additionalAnalyses
nested_items.description: An indicator as to whether additional analyses (such as Clean Rooms ML) can be applied to the output of the direct query.

nested_items.name: disallowedOutputColumns
nested_items.description: A list of columns that aren't allowed to be shown in the query output.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: differentialPrivacy
nested_items.description: The differential privacy configuration.

nested_items.name: columns
nested_items.description: The name of the column (such as user_id) that contains the unique identifier of your users whose privacy you want to protect. If you want to turn on diï¬-erential privacy for two or more tables in a collaboration, you must conï¬gure the same column as the user identiï¬er column in both analysis rules.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the column, such as user_id, that contains the unique identifier of your users, whose privacy you want to protect. If you want to turn on differential privacy for two or more tables in a collaboration, you must configure the same column as the user identifier column in both analysis rules.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of configured table analysis rule.

nested_items.name: createTime
nested_items.description: The time the configured table analysis rule was created.

nested_items.name: updateTime
nested_items.description: The time the configured table analysis rule was last updated.
